title: Crystal Foster, M.D.: Family and Community Medicine | Child and Adolescent Health | UT Southwestern Medical Center
description: Crystal Foster, M.D., is a Clinical Assistant Professor of Family and Community Health at UT Southwestern; she specializes in child, adolescent, and women's health.
sitename: Crystal Foster, M.D.: Family and Community Medicine | Child and Adolescent Health
cleaned_text: - Residency - Carolinas Healthcare System University (2008-2011), Family Medicine - Other Post Graduate Training - University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill School of Public Health (2006-2008) - Medical School - University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill (2003-2008) Crystal Foster, M.D. - Family Medicine - Child and Adolescent Health - Integrative and Preventive Medicine Biography Crystal R. Foster, M.D., M.P.H., is a Clinical Assistant Professor in the [Department of Family and Community Medicine](https://utswmed.org/why-utsw/departments/family-and-community-medicine/) at UT Southwestern Medical Center. She specializes in child and [adolescent health](https://utswmed.org/conditions-treatments/adolescent-and-young-adult-medicine/), integrative and preventive medicine, and [women's health](https://utswmed.org/conditions-treatments/womens-health/). Dr. Foster earned her medical degree at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill (UNC) School of Medicine, and she completed her residency in family medicine at Carolinas Medical Center. She also holds a master's degree in public health from the UNC School of Public Health. Board certified in [family medicine](https://utswmed.org/conditions-treatments/family-medicine/), she joined the UT Southwestern faculty in 2022. Dr. Foster is a member of the American Academy of Family Physicians, the American Medical Association, and the Texas Academy of Family Physicians. Her personal interests include swimming, reading, watching movies, traveling, and spending time with her husband and two children.
